position.marginalia_text: Ideoq[ue] dispositionis & [deleted: totius] operis radix calor est. Sed cu[m] [etc.]

marginalia.translation: For this reason, the root of disposition and the work is in the heat. But with etc.

position.marginalia_text: Et certe Ignis, siue Calor, est Ignis sive calor intentissimus, sic testante Maria: Mensura ignis tui esto sicut solis in diebus Junij & Juli&. Et vocatur Fimus equiuns, vt inquit Alphidius. Igne coquitur, quod tibi ostenda[m]. [etc]

marginalia.translation: And certainly, fire or heat is fire or the most intense heat, as attested to by Maria: The measure of your fire shall be like that of the sun during the days of June and July. And it is called a horse dung, as Alphidius says. What I showed you is matured by fire etc.

position.marginalia_text: Nam sicut Ignis Fimi augmentat frigidu[m] & humidu[m], propter sua[m] frigiditatem & humiditate[m]; qua[e] prohibetur: Ita fortitudo ignis calidi

marginalia.translation: For in the way that fire of the dung augments the cold and humid because of its cold and humidity, which are restrained. In such a way the strength of hot [and dry] fire
